sfrenderer
Class XTImage

java.lang.Object
  sfrenderer.XTImage

public class XTImage
extends java.lang.Object

Used to open, resize, rotate, crop and save images.

fontSize - Size of the font
r - Value for the red channel (0-255)
g - Value for the green channel (0-255)
b - Value for the blue channel (0-255)

setColor

public void setColor(int x,
                     int y,
                     java.awt.Color color)
Used to set the color (ARGB value) for a specific pixel in the image. Note that input x,y values are relative to the upper left corner of the image, starting at 0,0.

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(int x,
                               int y)
Used to retrieve the color (ARGB) values for a specific pixel in the image. Returns a java.awt.Color object. Note that input x,y values are relative to the upper left corner of the image, starting at 0,0.

        ArrayList histogram = image.getHistogram();
        int[] red = histogram.get(0);
        int[] green = histogram.get(1);
        int[] blue = histogram.get(2);
        int[] average = histogram.get(3);

Used to add an image "overlay" to the existing image at a given position. This method can also be used to create image mosiacs.

rotate

public void rotate()
Used to automatically rotate the image based on the image metadata (EXIF Orientation tag).

setWidth

public void setWidth(int Width)
Resizes the image to a given width. The original aspect ratio is maintained.

setHeight

Resizes the image to a given height. The original aspect ratio is maintained.

resize

public void resize(int Width,
                   int Height)
Used to resize an image. Does NOT automatically retain the original aspect ratio.

resize

public void resize(int Width,
                   int Height,
                   boolean maintainRatio)
Used to resize an image. Provides the option to maintain the original aspect ratio (relative to the output width).

getCorners

public float[] getCorners()
Used to retrieve the corner coordinates of the image. Coordinates are supplied in clockwise order starting from the upper left corner. This information is particularly useful for generating drop shadows, inner and outer glow, and reflections. NOTE: Coordinates are not updated after resize(), rotate(), or addImage()

sharpen

public void sharpen()
Used to sharpen the image using a 3x3 kernal.

desaturate

public void desaturate()
Used to completely desaturate an image (creates a gray-scale image).

desaturate

public void desaturate(double percent)
Used to desaturate an image by a specified percentage (expressed as a double or float). The larger the percentage, the greater the desaturation and the "grayer" the image. Valid ranges are from 0-1.

setOpacity

public void setOpacity(double percent)

flip

public void flip()
Used to flip an image along it's y-axis (horizontal). Vertical flipping is supported via the rotate method (i.e. rotate +/-180).

crop

                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
Used to subset or crop an image.

copyRect

                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
Returns a copy of the image at a given rectangle.

trim

public void trim()
Used to remove excess pixels around an image by cropping the image to its "true" extents. Crop bounds are determined by finding the first non-null or non-black pixel on each side of the image.

trim

public void trim(int r,
                 int g,
                 int b)
Used to remove excess pixels around an image by cropping the image to its "true" extents. Crop bounds are determined by finding pixels that *don't* match the input color. For example, you can trim off excess black pixels around an image by specifying an rgb value of 0,0,0. Similarly, you can trim off pure white pixels around an image by specifying an rgb value of 255,255,255. Note that transparent pixels are considered as null values and will be automatically trimmed from the edges.

setOutputQuality

public void setOutputQuality(double percentage)
Used to set the output quality/compression ratio. Only applies when creating JPEG images. Applied only when writing the image to a file or byte array.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Used to compare this image to another. If the ARGB values match, this method will return true.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

getIIOMetadata

public javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadata getIIOMetadata()
Returns the raw, javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadata associated with this image. You can iterate through the metadata using an xml parser like this: 
    IIOMetadata metadata = image.getMetadata().getIIOMetadata();
    for (String name : metadata.getMetadataFormatNames()) {
        System.out.println( "Format name: " + name );
        org.w3c.dom.Node metadataNode = metadata.getAsTree(name);
        System.out.println(javaxt.xml.DOM.getNodeValue(metadataNode));
    }

setIIOMetadata

public void setIIOMetadata(javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadata metadata)
Used to set/update the raw javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadata associated with this image.

getIptcData

public byte[] getIptcData()
Returns the raw IPTC byte array (marker 0xED).

getIptcTags

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> getIptcTags()
Used to parse IPTC metadata and return a list of key/value pairs found in the metadata. You can retrieve specific IPTC metadata values like this: 
    javaxt.io.Image image = new javaxt.io.Image("/temp/image.jpg");
    java.util.HashMap<Integer, String> iptc = image.getIptcTags();
    System.out.println("Date: " + iptc.get(0x0237));
    System.out.println("Caption: " + iptc.get(0x0278));
    System.out.println("Copyright: " + iptc.get(0x0274));

getExifData

public byte[] getExifData()
Returns the raw EXIF byte array (marker 0xE1).

getExifTags

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> getExifTags()
Used to parse EXIF metadata and return a list of key/value pairs found in the metadata. Values can be Strings, Integers, or raw Byte Arrays. You can retrieve specific EXIF metadata values like this: 
    javaxt.io.Image image = new javaxt.io.Image("/temp/image.jpg");
    java.util.HashMap<Integer, Object> exif = image.getExifTags();
    System.out.println("Date: " + exif.get(0x0132));
    System.out.println("Camera: " + exif.get(0x0110));
    System.out.println("Focal Length: " + exif.get(0x920A));
    System.out.println("F-Stop: " + exif.get(0x829D));
    System.out.println("Shutter Speed: " + exif.get(0x829A));
Note that the EXIF MakerNote is not parsed.

getGpsTags

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> getGpsTags()
Used to parse EXIF metadata and return a list of key/value pairs associated with GPS metadata. Values can be Strings, Integers, or raw Byte Arrays.

getGPSCoordinate

public double[] getGPSCoordinate()
Returns the x/y (lon/lat) coordinate tuple for the image. Value is derived from EXIF GPS metadata (tags 0x0001, 0x0002, 0x0003, 0x0004).

getGPSDatum

public java.lang.String getGPSDatum()
Returns the datum associated with the GPS coordinate. Value is derived from EXIF GPS metadata (tag 0x0012).

getUnknownTags

public javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadataNode[] getUnknownTags(int MarkerTag)
Returns a list of "unknown" IIOMetadataNodes for a given MarkerTag. You can use this method to retrieve EXIF, IPTC, XPM, and other format specific metadata. Example: 
    byte[] IptcData = (byte[]) metadata.getUnknownTags(0xED)[0].getUserObject();
    byte[] ExifData = (byte[]) metadata.getUnknownTags(0xE1)[0].getUserObject();

getMetadataByTagName

public javax.imageio.metadata.IIOMetadataNode[] getMetadataByTagName(java.lang.String tagName)
Returns a list of IIOMetadataNodes for a given tag name (e.g. "Chroma", "Compression", "Data", "Dimension", "Transparency", etc). 
  //Print unknown tags
    for (IIOMetadataNode unknownNode : metadata.getMetadataByTagName("unknown")){
        int marker = Integer.parseInt(javaxt.xml.DOM.getAttributeValue(unknownNode, "MarkerTag"));
        System.out.println(marker + "\t" + "0x" + Integer.toHexString(marker));
    }

getAttributeValue

public static java.lang.String getAttributeValue(org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap attrCollection,
                                                 java.lang.String attrName)
Used to return the value of a given node attribute. The search is case insensitive. If no match is found, returns an empty string.
